tweets.copy: imagine an agent hiring another agent. buyer locks 0.5 SOL for compute, seller delivers model inference in 800ms, smart contract releases payment automatically. zero humans involved. this is happening on devnet right now.

built SPL escrow that agents can use without knowing rust. python agent calls one function, funds get locked, other agent delivers service, payment auto-releases. the financial rails for the agent economy.
while ethereum agents wait 12 seconds for confirmation and pay $5 gas, solana agents complete 1000 transactions. 400ms blocks. sub-penny fees. this is why we built on solana.
6 months building in silence. 33 MCP tools. rust contracts. python SDK. typescript client. while everyone else raises series A we ship working code. devnet goes live monday.
your agent cant drain its wallet because the wallet doesn't belong to the agent. program-derived addresses mean the smart contract controls spending. agent gets an allowance, not the keys.

notes.voice: founder energy, lowercase, no corporate speak, technical but accessible
notes.diversity: covered 5 different core topics - no PDA repetition
notes.timing_spread: morning, midday, evening, night, weekend for optimal engagement
